6.15.17  5:18 am   Do you consider yourself a shitposter?

      why do you do such short, seemingly meaningless videos?

8.10.17  3:04 am   Why all the short erratic videos? 

     

6.15.17  5:18 am   why do you do such short, seemingly meaningless videos?

     

6.11.17  8:50 pm   You seem like a smart person that manages to mix inspiration, music, humor, and randomness in your works, and I love that. Like, it make me think "wow, when I grow up, I want to be him". So after this kinda lengthy introduction, here's my question: Why do you make your works so short? It kinda makes me sad, because it feels like you have so much potential, with all the music you make n' stuff, demonstrated in History of Japan and hotewig

     

5.20.17  2:22 pm  So why are all your other videos so...short?

     

5.19.17  1:40 pm   I've been wondering, why are some of your videos only 8 seconds long?

     

4.14.17  10:40 pm   Is there a reason why you did so many really short videos ? I really love them and hope to see more when you are done with this golgotha

     

3.16.17  9:53 pm   I love ur video, but why do they so short?

     

     starting with short projects is a good way to get started if you are feeling overwhelmed with the possibilities. i did that for a while, and then just when i was ready to move on, i accidentally got really popular on a video site that has a maximum time length of 6 and a half seconds, so i had to make even more short ones

html: 6.14.17  3:38 pm   i understand that you don't want searching for better and better sounds all the time to get in your way of just writing and recording, but don't you want to transcend a lot of cultural elements that have no distinct purpose to you that you were born into? like approximating the way notes fit together in harmony by using the equal temperament tuning? i dont mean like retune your keyboards, but when talking about microtonal music, i usually tend to think of tuning chords to the harmonic series, rather than the piano. i just hope you actively do that when you can instead of using an easier way all the time to get more content finished. after all you do seem like quite the creativity purist. hell im sure you've thought about it tho. nevermind. you don't need to respond to this im just rambling cause i get triggered when you say no to microtonal music. ur right, splitting half notes in half again doesn't really make that much sense

html:
6.14.17  3:30 pm   I think it's a good thing to learn as much music theory as possible, because learning theory will give you different "tools" that you can chose to use (or not use) at your disposal. But one thing I've noticed with these theory-nerds (myself included) is that they'll over think things. Sometimes a simple ii-V-I sounds better than a tritone substitution. Sometimes a triad (or a two part harmony, or even a single note) works better than a fancy extended chord. I think I'm a much better player after years of studying and learning, but when I was first learning music I'd write songs much faster and more easily than I do now... Do you ever run into this probelm?

     Do you ever catch yourself over thinking things or trying to make songs more complex than they need to be?
original_html:
6.14.17  3:30 pm   I think it's a good thing to learn as much music theory as possible, because learning theory will give you different "tools" that you can chose to use (or not use) at your disposal. Sometimes a triad (or a two part harmony, or even a single note) works better than a fancy extended chord. I think I'm a much better player after years of studying and learning, but when I was first learning music I'd write songs much faster and more easily than I do now... Do you ever run into this probelm?

     Do you ever catch yourself over thinking things or trying to make songs more complex than they need to be?
